disease.fact: Coronavirus disease (COVID-19) that was first reported from Wuhan, China, on 31 December 2019
The United States of America has the highest number of people infected by the virus
People can be infected more than once
Most common symptoms: fever, cough, tiredness, loss of taste or smell
Less common symptons: sore throat, headache, aches and pains, diarrhoea, a rash on skin, or discolouration of fingers or toes, red or irritated eyes
The virus does not transmit through water
COVID-19 vaccines do not create or cause variants of the virus that causes COVID-19. Instead, COVID-19 vaccines can help prevent new variants from emerging
The official names COVID-19 and SARS-CoV-2 were issued by the WHO on 11 February 2020
North Korea, the largest nation to report zero cases of Covid
